solution_line_template: 3 feet are in 1 yard and her fence is {fence_length_yards} yards long so her fence is {feet_per_yard}*{fence_length_yards} = <<{feet_per_yard}*{fence_length_yards}={fence_length_feet}>>{fence_length_feet} feet long

At maturity these trees will measure {tree_width_feet} feet and she needs them to run along her {fence_length_feet}-foot fence so she needs {fence_length_feet}/{tree_width_feet} = <<{fence_length_feet}/{tree_width_feet}={num_trees}>>{num_trees} trees
The trees cost ${tree_cost} apiece and she needs {num_trees} so {tree_cost}*{num_trees} = $<<{tree_cost}*{num_trees}={total_cost}>>{total_cost} worth of trees
